solution.text:
\( _{j}_\frac 12 - _{k}_\frac 34 - _{l}_\frac 23\)
\(= \frac {_{{(2*j)+1}}_}{2} - \frac {_{{(4*k)+3}}_}{4} - \frac{_{{(3*l)+2}}_}{3}\) [Converting mixed fractions into improper fractions]
LCM of the denominators of the 3 fractions, i.e. 2, 3, 4 = 12.
Writing the fractions with a common denominator, i.e. 12, we get:
\( (\frac {_{{(2*j)+1}}_}{2} \times \frac 66) - (\frac {_{{(4*k)+3}}_}{4} \times \frac 33) - (\frac{_{{(3*l)+2}}_}{3} \times \frac 44)\)
\(= \frac{_{{(12*j)+6}}_}{12} - \frac{_{{(12*k)+9}}_}{12} - \frac{_{{(12*l)+8}}_}{12}\)
\(= _{{Fraction((12*j)+6-(12*k)-9-(12*l)-8, 12)}}_\)
